The palpable midepigastric mass suggests a pancreatic mass. Therefore, the best way to manage this condition in the long term is insulin therapy with pancreatic enzyme replacement therapy to manage the malabsorption. Thiamine and 50% dextrose are used to treat acute episodes of Wernicke encephalopathy. Pancreatic resection followed by 5-fluorouracil with leucovorin is used to treat pancreatic cancer. Insulin aspart and glargine are indicated for diabetes management, but pancreatic enzyme replacement therapy should also be added to address the malabsorption.
